g1801.definition: [ἐνωτίζομαι] middle voice from a compound of {{g1722}} and {{g3775}}; to take in one's ear, i.e. to listen

g1802.definition: [Ἐνώχ] of Hebrew origin ({{h2585}}); Enoch (i.e. Chanok), an antediluvian

g1804.definition: [ἐξαγγέλλω] from {{g1537}} and the base of {{g32}}; to publish, i.e. celebrate

g1805.definition: [ἐξαγοράζω] from {{g1537}} and {{g59}}; to buy up, i.e. ransom; figuratively, to rescue from loss (improve opportunity)

g1807.definition: [ἐξαιρέω] from {{g1537}} and {{g138}}; actively, to tear out; middle voice, to select; figuratively, to release

g1809.definition: [ἐξαιτέομαι] middle voice from {{g1537}} and {{g154}}; to demand (for trial)

g1810.definition: [ἐξαίφνης] from {{g1537}} and the base of {{g160}}; of a sudden (unexpectedly) Compare {{g1819}}.

g1811.definition: [ἐξακολουθέω] from {{g1537}} and {{g190}}; to follow out, i.e. (figuratively) to imitate, obey, yield to

g1812.definition: [ἑξακόσιοι] plural ordinal from {{g1803}} and {{g1540}}; six hundred

g1813.definition: [ἐξαλείφω] from {{g1537}} and {{g218}}; to smear out, i.e. obliterate (erase tears, figuratively, pardon sin)

g1816.definition: [ἐξανατέλλω] from {{g1537}} and {{g393}}; to start up out of the ground, i.e. germinate

g1817.definition: [ἐξανίστημι] from {{g1537}} and {{g450}}; objectively, to produce, i.e. (figuratively) beget; subjectively, to arise, i.e. (figuratively) object

g1819.definition: [ἐξάπινα] from {{g1537}} and a derivative of the same as {{g160}}; of a sudden, i.e. unexpectedly Compare {{g1810}}.

g1820.definition: [ἐξαπορέομαι] middle voice from {{g1537}} and {{g639}}; to be utterly at a loss, i.e. despond

g1821.definition: [ἐξαποστέλλω] from {{g1537}} and {{g649}}; to send away forth, i.e. (on a mission) to despatch, or (peremptorily) to dismiss

g1822.definition: [ἐξαρτίζω] from {{g1537}} and a derivative of {{g739}}; to finish out (time); figuratively, to equip fully (a teacher)

g1823.definition: [ἐξαστράπτω] from {{g1537}} and {{g797}}; to lighten forth, i.e. (figuratively) to be radiant (of very white garments)

g1824.definition: [ἐξαυτῆς] from {{g1537}} and the genitive case singular feminine of {{g846}} ({{g5610}} being understood); from that hour, i.e. instantly

g1825.definition: [ἐξεγείρω] from {{g1537}} and {{g1453}}; to rouse fully, i.e. (figuratively) to resuscitate (from death), release (from infliction)

g1826.definition: [ἔξειμι] from {{g1537}} and εἶμι (to go); to issue, i.e. leave (a place), escape (to the shore)

g1827.definition: [ἐξελέγχω] from {{g1537}} and {{g1651}}; to convict fully, i.e. (by implication) to punish

g1828.definition: [ἐξέλκω] from {{g1537}} and {{g1670}}; to drag forth, i.e. (figuratively) to entice (to sin)

g1829.definition: [ἐξέραμα] from a comparative of {{g1537}} and a presumed ἐράω (to spue); vomit, i.e. food disgorged

g1831.definition: [ἐξέρχομαι] from {{g1537}} and {{g2064}}; to issue (literally or figuratively)

g1832.definition: [ἔξεστι] third person singular present indicative of a compound of {{g1537}} and {{g1510}}; so also      ἐξόν neuter present participle of the same (with or without some form of {{g1510}} expressed); impersonally, it is right (through the figurative idea of being out in public)

g1833.definition: [ἐξετάζω] from {{g1537}} and ἐτάζω (to examine); to test thoroughly (by questions), i.e. ascertain or interrogate

g1834.definition: [ἐξηγέομαι] from {{g1537}} and {{g2233}}; to consider out (aloud), i.e. rehearse, unfold

g1836.definition: [ἑξῆς] from {{g2192}} (in the sense of taking hold of, i.e. adjoining); successive

g1837.definition: [ἐξηχέομαι] middle voice from {{g1537}} and {{g2278}}; to "echo" forth, i.e. resound (be generally reported)

g1839.definition: [ἐξίστημι] from {{g1537}} and {{g2476}}; to put (stand) out of wits, i.e. astound, or (reflexively) become astounded, insane

g1840.definition: [ἐξισχύω] from {{g1537}} and {{g2480}}; to have full strength, i.e. be entirely competent

g1841.definition: [ἔξοδος] from {{g1537}} and {{g3598}}; an exit, i.e. (figuratively) death

g1843.definition: [ἐξομολογέω] from {{g1537}} and {{g3670}}; to acknowledge or (by implication, of assent) agree fully

g1844.definition: [ἐξορκίζω] from {{g1537}} and {{g3726}}; to exact an oath, i.e. conjure

g1845.definition: [ἐξορκιστής] from {{g1844}}; one that binds by an oath (or spell), i.e. (by implication) an "exorcist" (conjurer)

g1846.definition: [ἐξορύσσω] from {{g1537}} and {{g3736}}; to dig out, i.e. (by extension) to extract (an eye), remove (roofing)

g1847.definition: [ἐξουδενόω] from {{g1537}} and a derivative of the neuter of {{g3762}}; to make utterly nothing of, i.e. despise See also {{g1848}}.

g1848.definition: [ἐξουθενέω] a variation of {{g1847}} and meaning the same

g1849.definition: [ἐξουσία] from {{g1832}} (in the sense of ability); privilege, i.e. (subjectively) force, capacity, competency, freedom, or (objectively) mastery (concretely, magistrate, superhuman, potentate, token of control), delegated influence

g1851.definition: [ἐξοχή] from a compound of {{g1537}} and {{g2192}} (meaning to stand out); prominence (figuratively)

g1854.definition: [ἔξω] adverb from {{g1537}}; out(-side, of doors), literally or figuratively

g1856.definition: [ἐξωθέω]   or ἐξώθωfrom {{g1537}} and ὠθέω (to push); to expel; by implication, to propel

g1860.definition: [ἐπαγγελία] from {{g1861}}; an announcement (for information, assent or pledge; especially a divine assurance of good)

g1861.definition: [ἐπαγγέλλω] from {{g1909}} and the base of {{g32}}; to announce upon (reflexively), i.e. (by implication) to engage to do something, to assert something respecting oneself

g1862.definition: [ἐπάγγελμα] from {{g1861}}; a self-committal (by assurance of conferring some good)

g1863.definition: [ἐπάγω] from {{g1909}} and {{g71}}; to superinduce, i.e. inflict (an evil), charge (a crime)

g1865.definition: [ἐπαθροίζω] from {{g1909}} and ἀθροίζω (to assemble); to accumulate

g1868.definition: [ἔπαινος] from {{g1909}} and the base of {{g134}}; laudation; concretely, a commendable thing

g1869.definition: [ἐπαίρω] from {{g1909}} and {{g142}}; to raise up (literally or figuratively)

g1870.definition: [ἐπαισχύνομαι] from {{g1909}} and {{g153}}; to feel shame for something

g1874.definition: [ἐπακροάομαι] from {{g1909}} and the base of {{g202}}; to listen (intently) to

g1875.definition: [ἐπάν] from {{g1909}} and {{g302}}; a particle of indefinite contemporaneousness; whenever, as soon as

g1876.definition: [ἐπάναγκες] neuter of a presumed compound of {{g1909}} and {{g318}}; (adverbially) on necessity, i.e. necessarily

g1877.definition: [ἐπανάγω] from {{g1909}} and {{g321}}; to lead up on, i.e. (technical) to put out (to sea); (intransitively) to return

g1879.definition: [ἐπαναπαύομαι] middle voice from {{g1909}} and {{g373}}; to settle on; literally (remain) or figuratively (rely)

g1880.definition: [ἐπανέρχομαι] from {{g1909}} and {{g424}}; to come up on, i.e. return

g1881.definition: [ἐπανίσταμαι] middle voice from {{g1909}} and {{g450}}; to stand up on, i.e. (figuratively) to attack

g1882.definition: [ἐπανόρθωσις] from a compound of {{g1909}} and {{g461}}; a straightening up again, i.e. (figuratively) rectification (reformation)

g1883.definition: [ἐπάνω] from {{g1909}} and {{g507}}; up above, i.e. over or on (of place, amount, rank, etc.)

g1884.definition: [ἐπαρκέω] from {{g1909}} and {{g714}}; to avail for, i.e. help

g1885.definition: [ἐπαρχία] from a compound of {{g1909}} and {{g757}} (meaning a governor of a district, "eparch"); a special region of government, i.e. a Roman præfecture

g1886.definition: [ἔπαυλις] from {{g1909}} and an equivalent of {{g833}}; a hut over the head, i.e. a dwelling

g1887.definition: [ἐπαύριον] from {{g1909}} and {{g839}}; occurring on the succeeding day, i.e. ({{g2250}} being implied) to-morrow

g1888.definition: [ἐπαυτοφώρῳ] from {{g1909}} and {{g846}} and (the dative case singular of) a derivative of φώρ (a thief); in theft itself, i.e. (by analogy) in actual crime

g1890.definition: [ἐπαφρίζω] from {{g1909}} and {{g875}}; to foam upon, i.e. (figuratively) to exhibit (a vile passion)

g1891.definition: [Ἐπαφρόδιτος] from {{g1909}} (in the sense of devoted to) and Ἀφροδίτη (Venus); Epaphroditus, a Christian Compare {{g1889}}.

g1892.definition: [ἐπεγείρω] from {{g1909}} and {{g1453}}; to rouse upon, i.e. (figuratively) to excite against

g1893.definition: [ἐπεί] from {{g1909}} and {{g1487}}; thereupon, i.e. since (of time or cause)

g1894.definition: [ἐπειδή] from {{g1893}} and {{g1211}}; since now, i.e. (of time) when, or (of cause) whereas

g1896.definition: [ἐπεῖδον] and other moods and persons of the same tense; from {{g1909}} and {{g1492}}; to regard (favorably or otherwise)

g1898.definition: [ἐπεισαγωγή] from a compound of {{g1909}} and {{g1521}}; a superintroduction

g1900.definition: [ἐπέκεινα] from {{g1909}} and (the accusative case plural neuter of) {{g1565}}; upon those parts of, i.e. on the further side of
